intro: Thlaspi fendleri var. coloradense, commonly known as Colorado cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many ecologically and economically important species. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually lobed or toothed. This variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
